intro: Nissolia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered nissolia, is a shrub native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a mild aromatic scent. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Nissolia multiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
